TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IHttpAsyncHandler implements class System.Web.IHttpHandler

Docs.summary: Defines the contract that HTTP asynchronous handler objects must implement.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An <xref:System.Web.IHttpAsyncHandler> class can be associated with a file name extension or a particular URL by a configuration file, in the `httpHandlers` configuration section. The ASP.NET infrastructure will then instantiate and call the handler when the corresponding request is received. Alternatively, the handler can be defined in an .ashx file and when the corresponding request is received for the .ashx file the hander will be executed.

MemberSignature.Value: public IAsyncResult BeginProcessRequest (System.Web.HttpContext context, AsyncCallback cb, object extraData);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginProcessRequest(class System.Web.HttpContext context, class System.AsyncCallback cb, object extraData) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that provides references to intrinsic server objects (for example, , , , and ) used to service HTTP requests.
The to call when the asynchronous method call is complete. If cb is , the delegate is not called.
Any extra data needed to process the request.
Docs.summary: Initiates an asynchronous call to the HTTP handler.
Docs.returns: An that contains information about the status of the process.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EndProcessRequest(class System.IAsyncResult result) cil managed

Docs.param: An that contains information about the status of the process.
Docs.summary: Provides an asynchronous process End method when the process ends.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use <xref:System.Web.IHttpAsyncHandler.EndProcessRequest%2A> to raise any exceptions caught during the asynchronous process.
